description: T2	Holm Oak - Evergreen Oak (Quercus ilex)	Trim all round to tidy and shape, into a tight, tidy round shape. Final height = 6m and final spread = 6m.T3	Loquat (Eriobotrya japonica)	Thin out by approximately 30% to leave a more natural looking crown. Reduce overextended sections of the remaining crown, using the drop-crotch method to retain the natural shape of the tree. Final height = 4m and final spread = 3m.T4	Olive (Olea europaea)	Make new Pollard at approximately 2-2.5m from ground level. Final height = 2-2.5m and spread 0.5m.	T5	Olive (Olea europaea)	Make new Pollard at approximately 2-2.5m from ground level. Final height = 2-2.5m and spread 0.5mT7	Mimosa (Acacia dealbata)	Reduce laterally by 1-2m to alleviate weight on leaning tree. Final height is unchanged and final spread = 6m.T8	Holm Oak - Evergreen Oak (Quercus ilex)	20% Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by approximately 1-2m to reshape and rebalance, leaving a more rounded shape. Final height = 6m and final spread = 3m.T9	Holm Oak - Evergreen Oak (Quercus ilex)	20% Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by approximately 1-2m to reshape and rebalance, leaving a more rounded shape. Final height = 6m and final spread = 3m.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
